rename.to: @TestFactory should be able to return a single DynamicNode

body:
I think that's a valid feature request.

So, let's see what the rest of the @junit-team/junit-lambda says.
Does a single top-level container really make sense? Why not just use the `@TestFactory` method to group things instead?

Two reasons:

* A recursive approach to generating dynamic tests for a recursive data structure will typically yield the root node as top-level element, not a list of its children. Special-casing that or unpacking the children is meaningless boilerplate.
* The top-level container is associated with a concrete node in the graph and might be named accordingly whereas the test method itself could have a more general name:

    ![junit-5-hierarchical-test-output](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6537432/43714773-7e31bdd6-997e-11e8-89da-9b5986431d9f.png)
Thanks for the example! No objections from my side.

I came here looking for this feature. Without it [minutest](https://github.com/dmcg/minutest) ends up generating a vestigial root node, which is a shame. Happy to contribute if someone will point me in the right direction.

Generally speaking, **A** (see second bullet [here](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/issues/1521#issuecomment-410680679)), but for the special special case where the single returned node is a test (not a container), **B** may be ok...
Okay. Version **A** is ready for review in a few minutes...

...as **B** is almost impossible to implement. The display name for a dynamic test is determined at runtime and can't override the properties of the `@TestFactory`-annotated method node.

Updated the source snippet and image above showing now a sample for `DynamicTest` and  `DynamicContainer`.

issue.title: Support single dynamic node as return type

milestone.title: 5.4 M1
milestone.description: *Scope:* XML report generating listener, Test Kit for testing engines and extensions, new `junit-jupiter` dependency aggregating artifact for simplified dependency management in build tools, `TempDirectory` extension, display name generator API, test execution order API, API for accessing outer test instances, JUnit 4 `@Ignore` migration support, improved diagnostics and error reporting, discontinuation of the `junit-platform-surefire-provider`, as well as various minor improvements and bug fixes.

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
## Overview

Support single dynamic node as return type of a `@TestFactory`-annotated method.

Closes #1521 

---

I hereby agree to the terms of the [JUnit Contributor License Agreement](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/002a0052926ddee57cf90580fa49bc37e5a72427/CONTRIBUTING.md#junit-contributor-license-agreement).

---

### Definition of Done

- [x] There are no TODOs left in the code
- [x] Method [preconditions](http://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/api/org/junit/platform/commons/util/Preconditions.html) are checked and documented in the method's Javadoc
- [x] [Coding conventions](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#coding-conventions) (e.g. for logging) have been followed
- [x] Change is covered by [automated tests](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#tests) including corner cases, errors, and exception handling
- [x] Public API has [Javadoc](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#javadoc) and [`@API` annotations](http://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/api/org/junit/platform/commons/meta/API.html)
- [x] Change is documented in the [User Guide](http://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/user-guide/) and [Release Notes](http://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/user-guide/#release-notes)
- [x] All [continuous integration builds](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5#continuous-integration-builds) pass
